interactions:
Kayako - ticket id 60101543 // Randall Shawver commented publicly: Dear Christian,

My apologies. This ticket will stay open. Is the only issue that the duplicate emails are occurring when downloading via Pop3? Or are you experiencing the current Avira issue where the updates fail?

I checked your last logs and I could not locate the sample email. Did you compare the headers of the duplicates to see if they have a different message id? If they are different, then the mail system would consider them to be unique emails and not duplicates.

Best regards,
Randall Shawver
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

 My apologies. This ticket will stay open. Is the only issue that the duplicate emails are occurring when downloading via Pop3? Or are you experiencing the current Avira issue where the updates fail? 

 I checked your last logs and I could not locate the sample email. Did you compare the headers of the duplicates to see if they have a different message id? If they are different, then the mail system would consider them to be unique emails and not duplicates.

Kayako - ticket id 60101543 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear ATLAS,

Thank you for reaching out regarding your concerns about ticket #60094199. We understand the importance of keeping you informed about ongoing issues. Please refer to our status page for the latest updates on the current incident affecting the Avira Virus Scanner Engine, which may be related to your case. You can find detailed information and ongoing updates here: Mail Processing Impact – Avira Virus Scanner Engine [https://stspg.io/f5wj71cnsb2z].

If you continue to experience any issues after the incident has been resolved, please do not hesitate to contact us again. We are here to assist you.

Sincerely,

ATLAS

GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Closed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

 I completely understand your concern—having a ticket closed before your problem is solved is definitely frustrating. While I don’t have access to the internal notes or the specific actions taken on ticket #60094199, I can explain how the process usually works:

- Sometimes, tickets are closed automatically after a period of inactivity or if the support team believes the issue has been resolved based on the last update.
- If you feel your issue is still unresolved, you absolutely have the right to request that the ticket be reopened or to open a new ticket referencing the previous one.

You can find more details about ticket management in this article: Opening a New GFI Support Ticket [https://support.mailessentials.gfi.com/article/120990].

To move forward, I recommend either:
1. Reopening the ticket through the Support Portal and clearly stating that the problem is not resolved.
2. Opening a new ticket and referencing #60094199, explaining that the issue persists.
